Tokenization Grand Prix Application - Societe Generale-Forge (SG-Forge)

I. Product Summary

1. Project name: SmartCash Token

2. Product name: SGIS Smart Cash

3. Product type / underlying asset: Euro Medium-Term Note (EMTN) issued by SG Issuer (“SGIS”), a member of Societe Generale Group (“SG”), incorporated in Luxembourg, and collateralized by assets held at BNY Mellon SA/NV, Luxembourg branch. In addition, the EMTN are guaranteed by Societe Generale. The transaction dealer is Societe Generale.

The notes (“Security Tokens”) are registered on Ethereum by Societe Generale-FORGE (“SG-Forge”) acting as Registrar on behalf of the issuer SGIS.

These Security Tokens are characterized as debt securities and financial instruments under MIFID II and, in that respect, benefit from the same legal framework and conditions than traditional securities.

Underlying assets used as collateral for the EMTN consist of either [1] 100% of 3-month or lower duration US T-bills, or [2] 100% of all kind of securities with a value reviewed on a daily basis, excluding Societe Generale equity or Societe Generale unsecured debt instruments that are not authorized in the pool of collateral.

BNY Mellon controls every day that the value of the collateral is equal to, or higher than, the value of the EMTNs, to ensure the proper collateralization of the product.

4. Issuer jurisdiction: SGIS is incorporated in Luxembourg and the EMTNs are issued under French law.

5. Product website: Website available here Smart Cash | SG Forge

6. Primary contact name, title, and method of contact

  • For SG-Forge: Guillaume Chatain, Head of Sales at SG-Forge, Sylvain Prigent, Chief Product Officer at SG-Forge.
  • For Societe Generale: Philippe Dufay, Global Head of Technologies, Processes and Projects at SGCIB.

II. Company Details

1. Company description

Societe Generale – FORGE (“SG-Forge”) is a fully integrated subsidiary of Societe Generale Group which just celebrated its 160th birthday. SG-Forge is regulated as an investment firm under EU MiFID2 Regulation, as an Electronic Money Institution under MiCA (Markets in Crypto-assets) Regulation and as digital asset service provider under French law.

The company is an active member of the financial trade associations AMAFI and ICMA, a member of the board of the digital asset association ADAN, and member of the digital asset working groups of the AFME and Paris Europlace.

We provide issuers and investors, either Corporates or Financial Institutions, with end-to-end services to issue and manage digital-native financial products registered on the blockchain (Security Token).

For market infrastructure operators we build open, simple, secure and institutional-grade frameworks and models for Security Token operations, underpinned by banking class security and full regulatory compliance.

SG-Forge has been leading innovation in the blockchain space and financial services:

  • with the 1st covered bond tokenised in 2019,
  • as the lead of the syndicate for the inaugural €100m digital bond by the European Investment Bank in 2021,
  • the 1st bank subsidiary to ever borrow DAI stablecoin from DeFi protocol Maker DAO in 2023
  • the 1st subsidiary of a systemic bank to issue a stablecoin (EURCV) that is now fully compliant with MiCA since July 1st 2024,
  • the 1st financial institution to use a stablecoin (EURCV) to settle a primary bond issuance in 2023.

About Societe Generale: Societe Generale is one of the leading European financial services groups. Based on a diversified and integrated banking model, the Group combines financial strength and proven expertise in innovation with a strategy of sustainable growth.

Committed to the positive transformations of the world’s societies and economies, Societe Generale and its teams seek to build, day after day, together with its clients, a better and sustainable future through responsible and innovative financial solutions.

Active in the real economy for 160 years, with a solid position in Europe and connected to the rest of the world, Societe Generale has over 138,000 members of staff in 62 countries and supports on a daily basis 29 million individual clients, businesses and institutional investors around the world by offering a wide range of advisory services and tailored financial solutions.

2. Key personnel biographies

Jean-Marc Stenger, Chief Executive Officer: Jean-Marc joined Societe Generale in 2000 as an analyst based in Frankfurt, Germany. In 2003 he joined Lyxor Asset Management in Paris, a specialized asset management company of the Equity Derivatives division of the bank. He took responsibility for global portfolio management in 2005. From 2013 onward he served as Chief Investment Officer and contributed to the development of Lyxor’s activities in Europe, the US, Japan and Middle East with major pension plans and sovereign wealth funds. He left Lyxor in 2019, the company employing 600 staff world-wide and managing €137 billion at the time, to create Societe Generale - Forge and expand Societe Generale’s capabilities in the field of crypto assets. Jean-Marc is a member of the consultative commission of the Autorité des Marchés Financiers (AMF) and of the ECB New Technologies for Wholesale settlement - Contact Group (NTW-CG) on Digital Euro. He graduated in mechanical engineering from the Arts et Métiers (ENSAM).

Stéphanie Cabossioras, General Secretary: Stéphanie Cabossioras is a specialist of the regulation of financial and crypto markets and is deeply involved in the development of the blockchain ecosystem in France. She is General Secretary of Société Générale-FORGE, responsible for regulatory, legal, compliance and financial aspects. She has previously occupied positions in the French Financial Markets Authority as Deputy General Counsel, in the French Court of Audit as Senior Financial Auditor and in the Banque de France. She was recently Executive Director of Binance France.

Guillaume Chatain, Head of Sales: Prior to joining SG – Forge, Guillaume was Head of Institutional Sales for EMEA and APAC at Coinbase, and the Founder of a VC backed and FCA regulated digital broker-dealer having brought the first Structured Product onchain. Guillaume also spent a decade in traditional finance, as a Managing Director and Head of Equities and Equity Derivatives at J.P. Morgan Private Bank. He is a CFA charterholder, an Aerospace engineer and holds an MBA from Columbia Business School.

Sylvain Prigent, Chief Product Officer: Developing scalable solution for digital-native financial products registered on the blockchain (Security Token), for Bonds & Structured Products (issuance, asset servicing, operating model), and specialist in Digital asset structuring since 2018. Previously Sylvain spent more than 10 years at Societe Generale Investment Bank was Trading Risk Officer on repo and equity finance activities. He holds a Masters degree in Finance from ESLSCA in France.

3. Team size

50 people, with more than half of the employees working as product managers or engineers. It should be noted that critical functions in compliance, risk management, legal, IT infrastructure and HR are outsourced to Societe Generale enabling SG-Forge to keep a lean and agile structure while benefiting from the support, expertise, and standards of a systemic bank.

4. Years in operation

SG-Forge was founded in 2017 by a group of intrapreneurs within SG Group. The company was later converted into a fully owned subsidiary of the bank in 2020.

III. Product Information

1. Describe the product

SGIS Smart Cash is a product issued by SG Issuer (“the Issuer”) in accordance with the Base Prospectus dated 31 May 2024 and any supplements. The Programme is available on the website “ https://prospectus.socgen.com ” or upon request.

It’s issued as an EMTN or Notes, that are guaranteed by Societe Generale and secured with recourse against the Issuer. The Notes are also secured by a pledge over collateral assets contained in an account held by the Issuer with the Collateral Custodian, which is BNY Mellon SA/NV, Luxembourg branch. The only eligible collateral for the EMTN will be 3m or lower duration US T-bills, and the collateral is monitored by BNY Mellon as Collateral Monitoring Agent to ensure every day that its value is at least equal to the market value of the EMTN. In addition, the collateral is segregated from any other issuance and fully dedicated to back the value of the EMTN.

Mechanics of the collateral pool are available in the attached indicative termsheet under “Secured Notes Provisions.”

The Notes are denominated in USD and are redeemable at any point in time by the noteholder or by the Issuer with a notice of 5 business days. In addition, SG will provide a secondary market on the EMTN, and will commit to buy back the EMTN at their accrued value, with no bid/ask spread, with a T+1 settlement in fiat USD or T+2 in stablecoin USD (USDC or PYUSD or any other pre-agreed USD-denominated stablecoin) as described in the attached indicative liquidity letter.

Interests will accrue within the Notes. Upon redemption the Notes will pay a Final Redemption Amount equal to:

Final Redemption Amount = Specified Denomination x Product (i from Initial Valuation Date to Final Valuation Date) [100% +((Fixing(i) + Spread(i)) x n(i)/360)]

  • with the Reference Rate being SOFR (available of federal reserve Bank of New York SOFR Page)
  • Fixing(i) being the fixing of the Reference Rate published on Valuation Date(i) on the Relevant Screen Page at the Specified Time
  • n(i) means for each Valuation Date (i), the number of calendar days between Valuation Date (i) (included) and Valuation Date (i+1) (excluded)
  • Spread(i) means for each Valuation Date (i), the latest spread provided by Société Générale. Société Générale may adjust the spread on each Business Day, with a notice period of 7 calendar days. In such case, the Issuer will notify the Noteholders through the Registrar
  • On Initial Valuation Date, Spread(i) means:
    • [1] Minus 10 bps for a pool of 100% collateral consisting of 3-month or lower duration US T-bills, or
    • [2] Plus 10 bps for a pool of 100% collateral consisting of all kind of securities with a value reviewed on a daily basis, excluding Societe Generale equity or Societe Generale unsecured debt instruments, which are not authorized in the pool of collateral.
  • In the case of subscription with stablecoin (USDC, PYUSD or any pre-agreed stablecoin) we would charge up to 15 bps execution corresponding to direct costs incurred by SG-Forge to convert the stablecoin into fiat USD.
    • Note that we would work with SparkDAO/MakerDAO to reduce this cost as much as possible prior to subscribing to the product.

For additional information, please refer to the termsheet of the product.

2. Describe the underlying asset

For [1] the 3m or lower duration US T-bills that back the EMTN will be held by SGIS on an account opened with BNY Mellon, Luxembourg branch. No other asset will be eligible as collateral for the EMTN.

For [2] such collateral assets consisting of all kind of securities with a value reviewed on a daily basis, excluding Societe Generale equity or Societe Generale unsecured debt instruments, which are not authorized in the pool of collateral. These will also be held in by SGIS on an account opened with BNY Mellon.

3. How is yield transferred to the tokenholder (i.e., via rebasing, distributions, price accrual, etc.) and how often?

Yield is accrued in the tokenised Notes and paid together with the initial invested notional as part of the Final Redemption Amount.

4. What is the jurisdiction of the issuer and key entities?

  • Issuer is SG Issuer (“SGIS”) in Luxembourg. With LEI 549300QNMDBVTHX8H127.
  • Guarantor is Societe Generale, headquartered in France.
  • Dealer is Societe Generale, selling to the investor.
  • Registrar is SG-Forge, headquartered in France.
  • Custodian of collateral assets is BNY Mellon SA/NV in Luxembourg.

5. What is the asset eligibility criteria and/or concentration limitations for the portfolio as defined by the underlying documents?

There is no concentration limit, for [1] the only eligible assets will be 3m or lower duration US T-bills.

For [2] there is no specific diversification guideline. Societe Generale equity or Societe Generale unsecured debt instruments are not authorized in the pool of collateral.

In both cases the EMTN is guaranteed by Societe Generale.

6. Are any hedging or derivatives permitted in the underlying portfolio?

No.

7. Provide a list of all counterparties and service providers used by your product (i.e., custodians, trustees, reporting agents, exchange agents, banks, etc). Provide flow-charts or diagrams for all related entities and counterparties, if available.

Also see response to 4. Diagram illustrating cashflows below:

8. What is the AUM of the product? Provide a breakdown by blockchain

Smart Cash has not yet been issued on any blockchain. This is a TradFi product that is very successful with money market investors, as an alternative to certificates of deposits.

The current amount outstanding for non-tokenized Smart Cash Notes is in excess of $8bn.

9. What are the standard fees (i.e., subscription, redemption, management, etc.)?

The fees are embedded in the spread of the Notes. There are no subscription fees except in the case of subscription via stablecoins, no redemption fees, no management fees, no fees for custody and SG-Forge will make abstraction of the conversion fees between USDC and fiat USD. We estimate that SG Group fees (both for SGIS and SG-Forge) will be in the range of 10 basic points (bps) per annum.

Subscription fees in case of subscription via USD Stablecoins will be up to 15 bps, corresponding to a cost pass-through that we intend to reduce as much as possible prior to execution.

10. Other than the fees described above, can other expenses be paid from the proceeds of the product/assets?

Not applicable.

There are no other expenses associated with the products. The only expenses are the fees already embedded in the spread, and the subscription fees (if applicable).

11. How is your product permissioned? (e.g., primary users, secondary users)

Our security token smart contract is based on 3 operators who have the permission to call smart contract methods:

  • Registrar: Agent of the issuer and responsible of the register.
  • Registrar Agent: Operates under Registrar delegation for certain use cases.
  • Settlement Agent: In charge of the settlement.

12. What is the monthly transaction volume for the product?

We register between $200m and $1bn of activities (buy and sale) every month on the SGIS secured notes program.

13. What is the expected and maximum time for users to subscribe to and redeem from your product? Have you had any interruptions in your ability to process redemptions and subscriptions?

Subscriptions and redemptions are open during European banking hours, as described in the attached termsheet.

While using fiat currency to subscribe and redeem SGIS can meet settlement at T+1.

Should subscription and redemptions be required to take place is stablecoin (USDC) SG-Forge and SGIS would be able to offer settlements at T+2.

14. Provide a description of the subscription and redemption process. Include a diagram of the flow of funds, including each party involved.

Subscription in USDC:

  • Spark / Maker to contact SG-Forge and SG in order to subscribe to the product, confirm terms and notional, sign termsheet and transfer USDC to SG-Forge Wallet at T=0, with cut-off time being 1:30pm CET.
  • SG-Forge to convert the USDC into fiat USD using authorised market makers and transfer this fiat USD to SG.
  • Note to be issued by SGIS and tokenised by SG-Forge at T+2. Tokens are then held in custody with SG-Forge and safekept for the benefit of Spark / Maker.

Redemption in USDC:

  • Spark / Maker to contact SG-Forge and SG for a buy back. Confirm number of Notes that will be sold back to SG at T=0, with cut-off time being 1:30pm CET.
  • SG to buy back the agreed number of Notes and send corresponding amount of fiat USD to SG-Forge.
  • SG-Forge to convert fiat USD into USDC using authorised market makers and transfer this USDC to Spark / Maker whitelisted wallet at T+2.

Please see Diagram provided in 7.

15. Have any liquidity vehicles been established to enhance redemption and subscription efficiency? If so, describe how they work.

The EMTN includes a put option with a 5 business days’ notice period. This put option can be triggered on any day by the client with the issuer SGIS.

In addition, Societe Generale will provide a secondary market on the EMTNs, and will commit to buy back the EMTN at their accrued value, with no fees or bid/ask spread, through a T+1 settlement period (in fiat) or T+2 settlement period in stablecoin (USDC or PYUSD or any other pre-agreed USD stablecoin). This commitment will be formalized by a liquidity letter between Societe Generale and the client.

16. With what product can subscriptions and redemptions be made? (i.e., fiat, DAI, USDC, etc.)

Fiat USD

Stablecoins: USDC, PYUSD, or any other pre-agreed USD stablecoin

17. What are your future development plans for the product?

The product is currently available on Ethereum. We are working on deploying the Security Token, to multiple chains soon.

The TradFi product is highly successful and mature, and we do not expect further developments at this level.

SG-Forge is working to improve the stablecoin settlement process of its security tokens, notably to significantly reduce settlement cycle (with objective T=0), allow a larger range of stablecoins and improve security of the operations in preparation for higher volumes.

IV. Legal Structure

1. Explain the legal structure of the product and the jurisdictions in which it operates

The product is a Euro Medium-Term Note (EMTN) issued by SG Issuer (“SGIS”), a member of SG Group incorporated in Luxembourg, and collateralized by assets held at BNY Mellon SA/NV, Luxembourg branch. In addition, the EMTN are guaranteed by Societe Generale.

The notes are registered on Ethereum by Societe Generale-FORGE (“SG-Forge”) acting as Registrar on behalf of the issuer SGIS.

These Security Tokens are characterized as debt securities and financial instruments under MIFID II and, in that respect, benefit from the same legal framework and conditions than traditional securities.

2. What regulatory bodies oversee the product?

The EMTN are issued under a prospectus approved by the Luxembourg Commission de Surveillance du Secteur Financier (the CSSF) which is the Luxembourg competent authority for the purposes of Regulation (EU) 2017/1129, as amended (the Prospectus Regulation).

3. What licenses, permits, certificates, authorizations, registrations, concessions, approvals, exemptions does your product or company hold?

SG Issuer is a financial institution within the meaning of the Luxembourg act dated 5 April 1993 relating to the financial sector, as amended. The main activity of SG Issuer is the raising of funds via the issuance of securities to institutional and retail investors through distributors associated with Societe Generale. The funds raised through the issuance of such securities are subsequently on-lent to Societe Generale and other Group members.

Societe Generale acts as Guarantor. Societe Generale is a licensed French credit institution supervised by the Autorité de Contrôle Prudentiel et de Résolution, (“ACPR”), controlled by the Autorité des Marchés Financiers (“AMF”) and under the prudential supervision of the European Central Bank (ECB). In accordance to the provision of French Code Monétaire et Financier (Monetary and Financial Code), Societe Generale, as a credit institution licensed for the provision of investment services, is authorized to carry out all banking operations and provide all investment services except for the investment service of the operation of a multilateral trading facility (“MTF”) or an organized trading facility (“OTF”).

SG-Forge is authorised as an investment firm and authorised to provide MiFID II investment services under the supervision of the Autorité de Contrôle Prudentiel et de Résolution (ACPR) and the supervision of the Autorité des marchés financiers (AMF), authorised as an electronic money institution by the ACPR, and registered and authorised as a digital asset service provider (DASP) by the AMF.

4. How is bankruptcy remoteness established for assets of this product? Does the issuer have more than one product? Please provide separately any related legal opinions or supplementary documents regarding bankruptcy remoteness

Each series of EMTN benefit from a pledge agreement concluded between SGIS as issuer, BNY Mellon as Collateral Custodian and the Security Agent, creating a security over the collateral assets contained in the accounts held by SGIS with BNY Mellon directly in favour of the clients as represented by the Security Agent acting in its capacity of agent of the representative of the clients. As such, each series of EMTN is secured by its own accounts. No client shall be entitled to have recourse to the collateral assets contained in accounts other than the accounts which secures the EMTN held by such client.

5. What rights do tokenholders have?

The tokenholders have the rights attached to the EMTNs, i.e. to receive the payments described in the description of the termsheet of the product.

If there’s a default of SG or SIGS, the pledge on the collateral assets will be enforced by the Security Agent on behalf of the clients and the clients have rights to be paid amounts from the proceeds of such enforcement and the realisation of the related collateral assets up to the market value of their EMTNs, and in accordance with the order of priority.

6. Are there any pending or threatened legal proceedings or investigations against the company or any of its officers?

No

7. Describe any conflicts of interest the company or product may have with its officers or MakerDAO

None

8. Explain the potential tax implications associated with the product

All payments in respect of the EMTN and, if applicable, under the guarantee provided by SG, are made free and clear of, and without withholding or deduction for or on account of, any present or future taxes, duties, assessments or governmental charges of whatever nature imposed, levied, collected, withheld or assessed by or on behalf of any jurisdiction unless such withholding or deduction is required by law.

Potential purchasers and sellers of the EMTNs may be required to pay taxes in accordance with the laws and practices of the jurisdiction where they reside. Potential investors are advised to consult their own tax adviser on the tax impacts of the acquisition, holding, disposal and redemption of the EMTNs. The requirement to pay such taxes may reduce the effective yield on the Notes and may also have an adverse impact on their value.

V. Performance, Reporting, and Technical

1. Provide historical performance relative to the most relevant benchmark and explanations for any deviations from the benchmark

There has never been any default or any change in the performance of the products, which are always indexed on variable rates (e.g. SOFR for USD denominated products).

2. Describe the frequency, content, and process for performance and portfolio transparency reports. Who provides these?

In order to ensure that the EMTNs are collateralized in accordance with its terms, the collateral value and the EMTNs market value of each EMTN will each be tested from the issue date of such EMTN and on each business day onwards. These controls are done by BNY Mellon, as Collateral Monitoring Agent. Collateral reports can be sent to the client if required, including the detail of the collateral and their valuation.

3. Describe the accounting and auditing processes for the portfolio and product

For the financial years ended on 31 December 2022 and 31 December 2023, Ernst & Young S.A. Luxembourg were the statutory auditors of SGIS. SGIS publishes both audited interim financial statements and audited annual financial statements.

The financial statements of SGIS are available on: Prospectus (socgen.com)

4. Describe the technical implementation of your product

Technical implementation is based on ERC1155 with ERC20 satellite. The Smart Cash is natively on-chain and doesn’t need any custodian.

5. What audits have been performed on the smart contracts involved with your product, by whom, and when?

The audit has been performed by Haken and completed on 29/08/2024. Available on www.sgforge.com and here.

VI. MakerDAO Ecosystem

1. Describe any previous relationship with MakerDAO and familiarity working with DAOs

On January 16th, 2022 – SG-Forge has granted a loan to Societe Generale to refinance covered bonds held by the bank in the form of Security Tokens issued natively on the Ethereum public blockchain. SG-Forge funded this loan in the crypto market by borrowing DAI stablecoins from MakerDAO. Same Security Tokens were pledged to the benefit of the MakerDAO protocol.

SG-Forge has been able to enter into contractual agreements with the DAO using the voting process of the protocol. This financial, legal, and technological innovation implied different proposals and governance votes from the DAO community, notably:

  • A MakerDAO Initial Collateral Application made in September 20212
  • A MakerDAO Governance Poll and Executive Vote to accept the proposed Security Tokens as collateral for the transaction and elect a Maker Representative for executing the legal documentation and administrative tasks on behalf of the DAO
  • On August 2nd 2022 the MakerDAO community approved a DAI stablecoins credit line to SG-Forge.
[Security Tokens Refinancing] MIP6 Application for OFH Tokens Collateral Onboarding Applications
Dear MakerDAO Community, We submit to you, on behalf of European investment firm Societe Generale-Forge, this MIP6 application for discussion and approval of Security Tokens refinancing. This first experiment at the crossroads between regulated and open source initiatives, as described below, is intended to refinance a Covered Bond Token that has been issued last year on the Ethereum public blockchain. We let you take into consideration all the details, and we look forward to receiving your fee…
vote.makerdao.com

Maker Governance - Governance Portal

The MakerDAO Governance Portal allows for anyone to view governance proposals, and also allows for MKR holders to vote.

vote.makerdao.com

Maker Governance - Governance Portal

The MakerDAO Governance Portal allows for anyone to view governance proposals, and also allows for MKR holders to vote.

2. Beyond yield, how might your product benefit the SparkDAO and/or MakerDAO ecosystem?

SmartCash is a structured product that meets Spark / Maker requirements in terms of yield exposure to short term US treasuries.

Societe Generale is also one of the market leaders in structuring and issuance of a wide palette of structured products across asset classes and that are sold to institutional investors globally. Upon successful onboarding and clear understanding of the specific financial situation of the DAOs, SG structuring specialists would be able to suggest appropriate investment products. More information is available here: SG Structured Products (sg-structuredproducts.com).

Building a relationship with one of the very few systemic banks being involved in the permissionless blockchain ecosystem would also benefit the DAOs, improve its reputation and attract institutional investors in the respective ecosystems.

3. Does the product have integrations with any other platforms?

At this point in time the Smart Cash product doesn’t have integrations with other crypto / onchain platforms.

Other SG-Forge products, notably its EURCV Stablecoin is listed on Bitstamp and supported by market makers such as Wintermute and Flowdesk at this point in time.

4. Do you offer or plan to offer other products that could be appropriate for Spark or other SubDAOs?

Please see response to 2. New products can be developed on demand and based on SubDAO specific requirements.

item.title: Tokenization Grand Prix Application - DigitalX (SkyX)
item.dc:creator: DigitalX
item.description:
I. Product Summary

1. Project Name:
DigitalX Real World Asset Tokenisation (RWAx) Fund

2. Product Name:
SkyX

3. Product Type / Underlying Asset:
Short Duration Global Government Bonds, excluding US

4. Issuer Jurisdiction: United States

  • Feeder entity (the “SPV”) in Marshall Islands or Singapore
  • Real World Asset Tokenisation Fund as the master fund (the “Fund”) in Australia

5. Product Website:
DigitalX RWAx Website

6. Primary contact name, title, and method of contact:
Name: Omer Mohammad
Title: General Manager of Decentralised Finance and Technology
Email: omer@digitalx.com

II. Company Details

1. DigitalX
As the longest-standing blockchain company listed on the Australian Stock Exchange (ASX) - accounting for 80% of public equity volume in Australia - our purpose is finance for impact. We use technology to move communities towards financial systems that promote access, empowerment and create positive outcomes. We place investors in the best position possible for emerging technology, investing in and building Web3 infrastructure.

DigitalX thrives on the pillars of Technology, Finance, and Community - excelling in digital asset funds management for institutional investors and in developing blockchain-enabled products for capital markets applications. We are committed to improving accessibility and increased transparency to finance by building products and providing services to bridge digital assets & traditional finance.

2. Our experience
DigitalX has extensive experience within the digital asset space, recently hitting a decade for being listed on the ASX. The company has a seven-year track record of securely managing Bitcoin and digital assets, and is led by a team of experienced finance professionals and digital asset specialists. As a leading ASX-listed digital investment management company, DigitalX is focused on growing the blockchain economy through its digital asset funds management business, digital fintech, regtech products, and blockchain ventures.

3. Our key investment offerings

  • DigitalX Bitcoin ETF (BTXX): A fund providing investors exposure to spot Bitcoin through an ETF listed on the ASX.

  • Bitcoin Fund: A passive buy-and-hold investment strategy on BTC with institutional custody, insurance and independent administration in a unit trust.

  • Digital Asset Fund: An actively managed portfolio of Top 20 assets by market cap, focused on growth, utility and long-term sustainability factors.

  • Real World Asset Tokenisation Fund (RWAx): A diversified portfolio of real-world digital asset tokens.

4. Our track record
DigitalX has established a strong track record in digital asset management, with our Bitcoin Fund and DigitalX Fund ranked by Morningstar as the number one and three performing Australian funds in 2023, respectively. In FY24, our Bitcoin Fund saw exceptional growth with a 101.84% increase, and the DigitalX Fund experienced a substantial 88.91% rise to deliver strong returns to our investors. With a six-year history of providing clients with simplified access to actively managed digital asset portfolios, we continue to innovate by launching one of Australia’s first tokenisation funds - the Real World Asset Tokenisation Fund, also known as the RWAx Fund.

5. Our tokenization capabilities
DigitalX has built technical and commercial expertise in tokenization as part of the Real World Asset Tokenization Fund launch. We have advisory experience in supporting multiple ICOs, backdating to the first iterations of the tokenisation wave between 2015-18. We understand the key enablers and constraints for both DeFi and traditional regulated business models, developing appropriate templates and technologies to enable this intersectionality. During the last eighteen months, we have been improving our capabilities in real world asset tokenization and going live through the Fund that utilizes these capabilities with an underlying traditional fund structure, curating a ‘double book system’.

We apply a three C’s framework to assess and progress asset tokenisation initiatives: (1) customer, (2) commercial and (3) code.

6. Our team
Omer Mohammad - General Manager, DeFi and Technology (LinkedIn; Email)
Hannah Pham - Portfolio Manager (LinkedIn; Email)
Yuvraj Singh - Product Owner (LinkedIn; Email)
Mark Billington - Head of Operations (LinkedIn; Email)

III. Product Information

1. Describe the product
We propose Sky allocate up to 10% of the $1 billion pool to global government bonds outside of the U.S. to enhance risk-adjusted returns. To facilitate this, we offer tokenized global government non-US short-term bonds.

The proposed product is a tokenized investment in global government bonds outside the U.S., focusing on short-term bonds to minimize risk exposure.

Key features of this tokenized product are:

  • Underlying assets: global government bonds ex. US - either direct bond purchases, managed funds or ETFs
  • Short-Term Duration: Focus on short-term bonds to reduce risk exposure.
  • Good Yield: Outperform the S&P U.S. Ultra Short Treasury Bill & Bond Index.
  • Standardized and consistent investment process: We perform extensive due diligence on all assets to be included in the portfolio to ensure high-quality assets with proper durations. We integrate key fixed-income factors such as value, momentum, size, and liquidity into the asset allocation process. By actively managing exposure to these factors, the portfolio can achieve more stable and predictable returns.
  • Capital Preservation: The focus on high-quality, short-term bonds and active risk management aligns with the capital preservation goals of Sky. The portfolio offers a low-risk investment option, suitable for conservative investors seeking stable returns.
  • Income Generation: The portfolio’s emphasis on bonds with attractive yields offers a reliable source of income, appealing to income-focused investors. The regular coupon payments provide a steady income stream, supplementing other sources of income.
  • Broad diversification: The portfolio’s broad diversification across geographies and issuers, reducing exposure to specific risks and enhancing overall portfolio resilience. The inclusion of factors such as credit quality, value, and liquidity provides an additional layer of risk management and return potential. Sky can benefit from the portfolio’s systematic approach to capturing risk premia, aligning with their need for efficient risk-adjusted returns.

2. Describe the underlying asset
The underlying assets will be non-US government bonds. The countries and bonds are selected using a standardized and consistent investment process.

3. How is yield transferred to the token holder (i.e., via rebasing, distributions, price accrual, etc.) and how often?
The yield is compounded within the token.

4. What is the jurisdiction of the issuer and key entities?
The investment manager and the Fund entity are both domiciled in Australia.

5. What is the asset eligibility criteria and/or concentration limitations for the portfolio as defined by the underlying documents?
Asset eligibility criteria: Where the most efficient and liquid exposure to a country’s government bond is via a managed fund or ETFs, there is a requirement of AUM greater or equal to $200 mil.

Concentration limit: no investment including investment in a single bond, in a single country, a single managed fund, or a single ETF can exceed 20% of AUM.

6. Are any hedging or derivatives permitted in the underlying portfolio?
No.

7. Provide a list of all counterparties and service providers used by your product (i.e., custodians, trustees, reporting agents, exchange agents, banks, etc). Provide flow-charts or diagrams for all related entities and counterparties, if available.
All counterparties and service providers involved in RWAx are as follows:

  • Custodian: Certane
  • Trustee: True Oak
  • Fund Administrator: Automic

Please refer to Question 14 for flowcharts and diagrams.

8. What is the AUM of the product? Provide a breakdown by blockchain
This would be a share class specifically for Sky.

9. What are the standard fees (i.e., subscription, redemption, management, etc.)?
CONFIDENTIAL. Terms submitted via email for consideration.

10. Other than the fees described above, can other expenses be paid from the proceeds of the product/assets?
No.

11. How is your product permissioned? (e.g., primary users, secondary users)
The product is permissioned based on interaction with the issuer. In the flows below, any investor transaction action with the deployer wallet will need to have a KYC check and whitelisted address. This is a traditional fund admin KYC check. Fundamentally, any redemption or subscriptions will need to be done by a permissioned wallet.

If the wallet is not whitelisted, no investment action is taken.

No other restrictions apply on the token.

12. What is the monthly transaction volume for the product?
All the assets will be liquid. The goal is that redemption/subscription acts as a price support mechanism.

13. What is the expected and maximum time for users to subscribe to and redeem from your product? Have you had any interruptions in your ability to process redemptions and subscriptions?
Expected Two Business Days.

  1. Provide a description of the subscription and redemption process. Include a diagram of the flow of funds, including each party involved.

Subscription flow:

  1. Investor wishes to invest
    a. Completes KYC/AML identification check
  2. As the on-ramp, investor purchases stablecoin and transfer it to SPV
  3. SPV mints and sends tokens to investor wallet
    a. Buys the underlying Fund units as part of the ‘unitisation’ process

Redemption flow:

  1. Investor wishes to withdraw
    a. Completes KYC/AML identification check
  2. Tokens are sent to SPV
  3. SPV sells the Fund units and receives net asset value.
  4. SPV returns stablecoin back to the investor and burns received tokens

SkyX Flow of Funds

15. Have any liquidity vehicles been established to enhance redemption and subscription efficiency? If so, describe how they work.
No, but asset vehicles used, for example ETFs, are very liquid.

The portfolio’s focus on liquid assets ensures that we can meet Sky’s liquidity requirements. There are allocation decisions like using ETFs and/or liquid funds that can enhance liquidity as these vehicles often provide better liquidity than individual bonds and can be easily traded. We carefully weigh direct individual bonds, AUM and liquidity in our portfolio allocation decisions. We set strict requirements that need to be met around quality, liquidity and diversification.

There is no lock-up or minimum holding period.

16. With what product can subscriptions and redemptions be made? (i.e., fiat, Dai, USDC, etc.)
USDS, DAI, USDC or fiat

17. What are your future development plans for the product?
Tokenising more asset classes to enhance diversification, including but not limited to: real estate, stock, corporate bonds, commodities, venture capital, private debt, private equity and art.

In possible future circumstances, the tokenised versions of the Fund’s Unit will be tradable on a private placement basis or on a digital exchange, potentially offering further liquidity opportunities for Unit Holders. Investors will be notified ahead of any secondary trading opportunities - subject to laws and compliance obligations in place at the time.

IV. Legal Structure

1. Explain the legal structure of the product and the jurisdictions in which it operates.
The product is run by DigitalX Asset Management as the investment manager through the Real World Asset Tokenisation Fund (the ‘Fund’) in Australia. This Fund is open to wholesale investors. The trustee of the Fund is True Oak Investments Ltd (ABN 81 002 558 956) (the Trustee).

We have feeder fund structures in Singapore and Marshall Islands that feed directly into the Fund. We are open to discussing a more favourable and synergistic legal structure to accommodate Sky.

2. What regulatory bodies oversee the product?
The Trustee of the Fund is a holder of the Australian Financial Services Licence (AFS Licence No, 238184). The Fund operates in compliance with regulations by the Australian Securities and Investments Commission (ASIC).

3. What licenses, permits, certificates, authorizations, registrations, concessions, approvals, and exemptions does your product or company hold?
The Fund is an unregistered managed investment scheme structured as a unit trust.

4. How is bankruptcy remoteness established for assets of this product? Does the issuer have more than one product? Please provide separately any related legal opinions or supplementary documents regarding bankruptcy remoteness.
The Fund as the unit trust sits at the center of the transaction and it owns the underlying assets both legally and beneficially. The Trustee only acts on behalf of the unit holders/token holders. All trust assets are legally separate from the Trustee’s personal assets and are in the custody of the custodian. The Unit Trust can survive the insolvency of the Investment Manager, the Trustee, the Custodian or any service provider.

5. What rights do token holders have?
We will issue tokens (SkyX) at the feeder entity in either Marshall Islands or Singapore. The SkyX tokens will represent the proportionate right to the revenue generated by the SPV from the Fund units.

We are open to discussing which structure and token would be most appropriate and beneficial for Sky.

6. Are there any pending or threatened legal proceedings or investigations against the company or any of its officers?
No.

7. Describe any conflicts of interest the company or product may have with its officers or MakerDAO
No conflicts of interest.

8. Explain the potential tax implications associated with the product
The Fund complies with Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act (FATCA) and follows Common Reporting Standard (CRS).

The Fund’s investments can include shares/units of ETFs and funds. These funds can be subject to withholding tax on any income received from underlying bonds, depending on their jurisdictions.

V. Performance, Reporting and Technical

1. Provide historical performance relative to the most relevant benchmark and explanations for any deviations from the benchmark
This is a tailored product proposal so no historical performance. Backtesting, in the past 3 years, the suggested country allocation generates excess returns of 120 bps on a comparable US government bond portfolio.

2. Describe the frequency, content, and process for performance and portfolio transparency reports. Who provides these?
Onchain lookthrough: Anyone can monitor the reserve/underlying assets on-chain

Daily performance published online: Daily indicative NAV via the website

Published Monthly fund statement and a monthly NAV via the website.

NAV data is aggregated market data of the current holdings of the portfolio.

Historical NAV data download is available on the website.

This transparency fosters trust and confidence in the product, making it an attractive option for investors who value clarity and simplicity.

3. Describe the accounting and auditing processes for the portfolio and product
The Fund accountant prepares:

  • a monthly report on the net asset value of the Fund;
  • an annual statement including audited financial report for the Fund and annual tax statement following the end of financial year at 30 June;
  • regular updates from the Manager on the performance of the Fund and its investments; and
  • a transaction statement each time you make an investment, reinvestment, or withdrawal.

The Fund is audited annually by a reputable auditor.

4. Describe the technical implementation of your product
We deliver a secure and compliant investor experience. We facilitate off-chain digital experience and on-chain fund investing options. Actions are synchronized on-chain.

We have an ERC-20 token that represents the Fund’s Net Asset Value at a daily level. We post the NAV holdings daily to the contract. Separately, we have a website where we provide current and historical net asset value at a daily level and at the struck end of month net asset value and end of month units outstanding.

We distribute this token via platforms or directly to KYC/AML investors.

5. What audits have been performed on the smart contracts involved with your product, by whom, and when?
Last smart contract audit was performed by Hashlock in April 2024.

VI. MakerDAO Ecosystem

1. Describe any previous relationship with MakerDAO and familiarity working with DAOs
Alignment of interest with Sky (MakerDAO), DigitalX Digital Asset Fund, also managed by DigitalX Asset Management, holds MakerDAO tokens.

DigitalX has previously worked on a DAO proof of concept to create decentralized investment validation with ArbelaDAO.

2. Beyond yield, how might your product benefit the SparkDAO and/or MakerDAO ecosystem?
Diversification is a cornerstone of sound investment strategy as it is crucial for mitigating risk. In today’s globalized economy, investors seek to broaden their portfolios beyond traditional asset classes and geographical boundaries. Investing in global bonds, especially those outside the US, we can provide a number of diversification benefits to Sky.

Risk Mitigation
While U.S. Treasury bills are secure, they are not immune to market shifts that can affect their performance. By investing in high quality bonds from other governments around the world, Sky’s exposure will spread across different economic environments and interest rate regimes. These countries can be at different points in their economic and interest rate cycles compared to the US, so their bonds can offer a hedge against US idiosyncratic market volatility. By holding a diversified mix of bonds from different countries, we will reduce Sky’s reliance on the U.S. economic cycle and interest rate environment. This strategy not only aims to preserve capital but also seeks to enhance returns by taking advantage of different global economic cycles. In the long run, this approach can lead to a more resilient portfolio, capable of weathering various economic conditions while still providing steady income and capital preservation.

Hedge against Currency risk
Global government bonds can offer a valuable hedge against currency risk, particularly in the context of long-term forecasts for the U.S. dollar. Vanguard’s proprietary model estimates that the U.S. dollar is roughly 12% overvalued against a basket of five leading currencies heading into 2024. In the coming decade, it is estimated that the probability of some dollar depreciation at about 75%, with a modest decline of 1.1% annualized the most likely outcome (Source). Investing in bonds denominated in foreign currencies allows the portfolio to be diversified beyond the U.S. dollar. If the dollar weakens as forecasted, the value of the portfolio’s holding in stronger foreign currencies could increase, therefore boosting Sky’s overall returns. This potential appreciation in foreign currencies could help offset any declines in the US dollar’s value, effectively providing a natural hedge against the risks associated with a weakening domestic currency.

3. Does the product have integrations with any other platforms?
The DigitalX Real World Asset Tokenisation Fund token - the Fund is about to list for both wholesale and retail markets, respectively on a Web3 RWA platform.

4. Do you offer or plan to offer other products that could be appropriate for Spark or other SubDAOs?
We currently have tokenized Australian residential properties, Australian ETFs and Australian corporate bonds. We also have the appropriate licensing and technical capability to tokenize other types of assets such as commodities, venture capital, private debt, private equity and we plan to continue to expand this asset base. We can provide Spark or other SubDAOs with exposure across multiple asset classes across different risk profiles, investment horizons and geographic locations.

VII. Investment Process

Due Diligence
We screen all available investments in government bonds globally. We then use a proprietary, data-driven, universal scoring process - referred to as the Universal Scoring Matrix (USM) - through which investment selection criteria are programmed into a scorecard. The USM helps us compare each investment opportunity using a standardized and consistent approach for scoring various attributes of the investment. A higher score may reflect a superior risk/reward investment proposition.

Criteria used to evaluate each asset include:

  • Liquidity Screening: The portfolio will prioritize assets with high liquidity, ensuring that trades can be executed efficiently and cost-effectively. We have an AUM threshold (for now, at least $200mil AUM), high trading volumes, and well-established issuers. This ensures that the portfolio can be adjusted with minimal impact on market prices. We avoid illiquid assets by excluding funds and bonds with known liquidity issues or those that are difficult to trade, such as smaller issues or bonds from issuers with lower visibility.
  • Asset performance compared to relevant benchmark
  • Identification of any legal or reputation risks. We establish minimum rating requirements for assets to be included in the portfolio. This reduces exposure to lower-rated, riskier bonds and ensures a higher quality of credit risk.
  • Operating track record including how long the funds have been in operation

All assets must pass this due diligence to be included in the portfolio.

Asset Allocation
Our asset allocation process utilizes transparent and efficient allocation methodologies to select underlying assets that maximize risk-adjusted returns and diversification benefits.

Factor-based allocation: Instead of market-value weighting potentially leading to over-concentration in issuers with large amounts of outstanding debt, we allocate assets based on risk-weighted approaches to allocate assets. Our asset allocation approach targets specific characteristics or factors that have historically been associated with higher returns or lower risk. Those factors include size, credit quality, value and momentum signals.

Regular Rebalancing: The portfolio will be regularly rebalanced to maintain target allocations to the identified factors and to ensure compliance with risk parameters. This process involves adjusting positions to reflect changes in market conditions, issuer fundamentals, and investor preferences.

Risk Monitoring and Management: Ongoing risk monitoring will be conducted to assess the portfolio’s exposure to interest rate risk, credit risk, and other market risks. The portfolio’s duration, credit quality, and sector exposures will be actively managed to align with the investment objectives and risk tolerance.

Macroeconomic and Market Analysis: The investment team will closely monitor global economic indicators, central bank policies, and market trends to inform strategic decisions. This analysis will guide adjustments to the portfolio’s allocation to different regions, sectors, and factors.

Stress Testing and Scenario Analysis: The portfolio will undergo regular stress testing and scenario analysis to evaluate its performance under various market conditions. This process helps identify potential vulnerabilities and ensures that the portfolio remains resilient in the face of adverse events.

VIII. Conclusion

The Fund represents a unique opportunity for Spark to diversify its government bonds assets across different economic environments and interest rate regimes. The portfolio helps reduce concentration risk and US$ currency risk, manage volatility and preserve capital while capturing attractive risk-adjusted returns. This comprehensive strategy aligns with the Spark’s overall objectives of diversification, stability, and liquidity.

Weekly rebasing tokenized short-term US Treasuries called Stablebonds. Our Stablebond tokens accrue interest, allowing users to purchase and retain their yield like any other investment. By holding onto Stablebonds, token holders receive a guaranteed return from the government bond and the interest accrued on their token.

All of our underlying assets are government-issued, short-term US treasuries that guarantee return for token holders. Our US Treasury bonds currently offer a 5% return.

  1. How is yield transferred to the token holder (i.e., via rebasing, distributions, price accrual, etc.) and how often?

Etherfuse tokenized bonds are interest-bearing tokens. Each week, upon bond issuance, tokens are automatically reinvested and accrue yield based on the interest of each bond. Users can divest and redeem their tokens anytime, which will be processed on the day of new issuances.

  1. What is the jurisdiction of the issuer and key entities?

Etherfuse is headquartered and regulated in Mexico City and operates in partnership with BBVA, Actinver, and Kuspit to maintain its reserves.

To mint and redeem directly from Etherfuse users must be KYC’d through our platform, SDK or contract. We currently do not offer our products to US persons or US companies.

Our tokens do not have any restrictions and a holder may interact with them freely. The underlying asset of the token is 1:1 with US treasuries.

Actinver: Fitch AA & F1+

Kuspit

Solana 2MM

.25% APY of AUM

12.What is the monthly transaction volume for the product?

As we are directly integrated with the stock exchange and our brokerages, we do not have any volume limitations. We can both mint and redeem any size weekly. The currency volume is around 200k USD weekly.

The expected time is about three months due to the yield accrual on these tokens. We have not had any issues processing redemptions or subscriptions.

Minting/Purchasing

Divesting

Flow of Funds

16.With what product can subscriptions and redemptions be made? (i.e., fiat, Dai, USDC, etc.)

USDC

We intend to integrate the product onto more blockchains and exchanges. Additionally, create other products with different sovereign treasury instruments.

IV. Legal Structure

  1. Explain the legal structure of the product and the jurisdictions in which it operates.

We are both operated and regulated in Mexico. We are only excluded from working with a few localities generally found on terrorist watch lists and the US.

  1. What regulatory bodies oversee the product?

CNBV Comisión Nacional Bancaria y Valores, who is responsible for regulating Mexican financial institutions. Our products and services are in compliance with corporate laws and Mexican Regulations:
